Read more here:  https://www.crapo.senate.gov/media/newsreleases/senators-to-lead-rally-for-secure-rural-schools-legislation¬†‚Ä¶

This bipartisan Secure Rural Schools (SRS) program legislation @RonWyden, @SenatorRisch, @SenJeffMerkley and I introduced will provide funding needed for schools, road maintenance, law enforcement and other essential services.

It's time to create a permanent, lasting program for Idaho counties and schools surrounded by tax-exempt federal forests. A long-term endowment assisted by timber harvest receipts receipts would ensure certainty for parents, students and those traveling Idaho‚Äôs roads and bridges.

The SRS program provides much-needed financial certainty for rural counties to ensure they have the long-term funding needed for schools, road maintenance, law enforcement and other essential services.
HAPPENING THURSDAY: I will join @RonWyden and @SenatorRisch to discuss permanent funding for the Secure Rural Schools (SRS) Program.

As its rightful owner, an individual should have real control over his or her data. Consumers deserve to know what type of information is being collected about them, what that information is being used for and how it is being shared.

Data can be used in ways that have big implications for people‚Äôs financial lives, including to market or make decisions on financial products or services that impact a consumer‚Äôs access to or cost of credit and insurance products, or in ways that impact employment prospects.
